intro: Canthium senegalense, commonly known as African hogweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant can grow up to 3 meters tall and has a woody stem that becomes more prominent with age. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that contain numerous tiny seeds, aiding in its dispersal. Canthium senegalense is often found in moist habitats such as riverbanks and forests.
